00001 /**
00002  * @file usart.c
00003  * @date 2007-Dez-11
00004  * @author S. Rohdemann, S. Radtke
00005  * @c (C) 2007 Nanotron Technologies
00006  * @brief Console support functions.
00007  *
00008  * @note BuildNumber = "BuildNumber : 7951";
00009  *
00010  * @note This file contains the source code for the console
00011  *       and serial port support functions.
00012  */
00013 #include    "config.h"
00014 #include    "ntrxtypes.h"
00015 #include    "usart.h"
00016 #include    "avrport.h"
00017 
00018 #include    <avr/io.h>
00019 #include    <avr/interrupt.h>
00020 #include    <stdio.h>
00021 // #define ENTER_TASK {unsigned char cSREG=SREG; cli();
00022 // #define LEAVE_TASK  SREG=cSREG; sei();}
00023 
00024 volatile uint8_t serBuffer;
00025 volatile uint8_t full;
00026 
00027 int _getchar(FILE *stream);
00028 int _putchar(char c, FILE *stream);
00029 static FILE stdinouterr = FDEV_SETUP_STREAM (_putchar, _getchar, _FDEV_SETUP_RW );
00030 
00031 /**
00032  * @brief interrupt USART1_REC
00033  *
00034  * The interrupt service routine for receiving characters on the console i/f
00035  */
00036 SIGNAL(AVR_USART_RECV)
00037 {
00038     serBuffer = AVR_UDR1;
00039     full = 1;
00040 }
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * @brief Initialize console i/o support
00044  *
00045  * This function initializes the usart interface of the AVR uController
00046  */
00047 void    console_init(void)
00048 {
00049 
00050     /*
00051      * enable UART 1
00052      */
00053     AVR_UBRR1H = 0;                                         /* USART1: 38400 bps */
00054     AVR_UBRR1L = 11;
00055     AVR_UCSR1C = (1 << AVR_UCSZ11) | (1 << AVR_UCSZ10);     /* USART1: asynchronous 8N1 */
00056     AVR_UCSR1B = (1 << AVR_RXCIE1) | (1 << AVR_RXEN1)
00057                | (1 << AVR_TXEN1);                          /* USART1: TX and RX
00058                                                                     and RXCIE enabled */
00059 
00060     full = 0;
00061     stdout = &stdinouterr;
00062     stdin  = &stdinouterr;
00063     stderr = &stdinouterr;
00064 
00065     sei ();
00066 
00067 }
00068 
00069 /*
00070  * the following function need iogetc/ioputc/iostat from iolow.c
00071  */
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * @brief reads the next character from the console interface
00075  * @param stream to I/O stream
00076  * @returns the next octet from the given I/O stream
00077  */
00078 int _getchar(FILE *stream)
00079 {
00080     while (full == 0);
00081     full = 0;
00082     return serBuffer;
00083 }
00084 
00085 /**
00086  * @brief transmits the octet via i/o stream
00087  * @param c octet to be send
00088  * @param stream i/o stream
00089  */
00090 int _putchar(char c, FILE *stream)
00091 {
00092     if(c == '\n')
00093     {
00094         while((AVR_UCSR1A & (1 << AVR_UDRE1)) == 0);
00095         AVR_UDR1 = '\r';
00096     }
00097 
00098     while((AVR_UCSR1A & (1 << AVR_UDRE1)) == 0);
00099     AVR_UDR1 = c;
00100 
00101     return  0;
00102 }
00103 
00104 /**
00105  * kbhit:
00106  *
00107  * kbhit() returns the status of the console interface
00108  *
00109  * Returns: 1 if one or more characters are ready for input
00110  *          0 otherwise
00111  */
00112 int     kbhit(void)
00113 {
00114     return  full;
00115 }
00116 
00117 #ifdef  CONFIG_CONSOLE
00118 /**
00119  * @brief read line from console
00120  * @param buf buffer to fill out.
00121  *
00122  * Read one line from the console interface. read_line() polls the console
00123  * for input. If a character is available it will be stored in buf.
00124  * If ENTER is read the buffer will be closed with '\\0'.
00125  * The '\\n' or '\\r' is NOT stored in buf.
00126  *
00127  * @returns buf if a complete line is read in
00128  *          0 otherwise
00129  */
00130 char    *read_line(char buf[])
00131 {
00132     static  int     cnt = 0;
00133     char            c;
00134 
00135     if(!kbhit())
00136     {
00137         return  (char *) 0;
00138     }
00139 
00140     c = getchar();
00141 
00142     if(c == '\n' || c == '\r')
00143     {
00144         putchar('\r');
00145         putchar('\n');
00146         buf[cnt] = 0;
00147         cnt = 0;
00148         return  buf;
00149     }
00150     else
00151     {
00152         if(c == '\b' || c == 0x7f)
00153         {
00154             if(cnt > 0)
00155             {
00156                 cnt--;
00157                 putchar('\b');
00158                 putchar(' ');
00159                 putchar('\b');
00160             }
00161             return  (char *) 0;
00162         }
00163 
00164         if(cnt < CONFIG_CONSOLE_LINE_SIZE-1)
00165         {
00166             if(c >= 0x20 && c < 0x7f)
00167             {
00168                 buf[cnt++] = c;
00169                 putchar(c);
00170             }
00171         }
00172         return  (char *) 0;
00173     }
00174 }
00175 #endif  /* CONFIG_CONSOLE */
